info.title: Octez Mempool RPC
info.description: The RPC API for the mempool served by the Octez node.

post.description: Remove an operation from the mempool if present. Also add it to the set of banned operations to prevent it from being fetched/processed/injected in the future. Note: If the baker has already received the operation, then it's necessary to restart it to flush the operation from it.

schema.description: An error trace. The full list of errors is available with the global RPC `GET errors`

get.description: Get the configuration of the mempool's filter and bounds. Values of the form [ "21", "20" ] are rational numbers given as a numerator and a denominator, e.g. 21/20 = 1.05. The minimal_fees (in mutez), minimal_nanotez_per_gas_unit, and minimal_nanotez_per_byte are requirements that a manager operation must meet to be considered by the mempool. replace_by_fee_factor is how much better a manager operation must be to replace a previous valid operation **from the same manager** (both its fee and its fee/gas ratio must exceed the old operation's by at least this factor). max_operations and max_total_bytes are the bounds on respectively the number of valid operations in the mempool and the sum of their sizes in bytes.

parameters.name: include_default
parameters.description: Show fields equal to their default value (set by default)

schema.description: An error trace. The full list of errors is available with the global RPC `GET errors`

post.description: Set the configuration of the mempool's filter and bounds. **If any of the fields is absent from the input JSON, then it is set to the default value for this field (i.e. its value in the default configuration), even if it previously had a different value.** If the input JSON does not describe a valid configuration, then the configuration is left unchanged. This RPC also returns the new configuration of the mempool (which may differ from the input if the latter omits fields or is invalid). You may call [octez-client rpc get '/chains/main/mempool/filter?include_default=true'] to see an example of JSON describing a valid configuration. See the description of that RPC for details on each configurable value.

schema.description: An error trace. The full list of errors is available with the global RPC `GET errors`

parameters.name: branch_delayed
parameters.description: Include branch delayed operations (set by default)

parameters.name: validation_pass
parameters.description: Include operations filtered by validation pass (all by default)

parameters.name: sources
parameters.description: Include operations filtered by sources (all by default)

schema.description: An error trace. The full list of errors is available with the global RPC `GET errors`

parameters.name: branch_refused
parameters.description: Include branch refused operations (true by default)

parameters.name: branch_delayed
parameters.description: Include branch delayed operations (true by default)

parameters.name: validation_pass
parameters.description: Include operations filtered by validation pass (all by default)

parameters.name: source
parameters.description: Include operations filtered by source (all by default)

parameters.name: operation_hash
parameters.description: Include operations filtered by hash (all by default)

schema.description: An error trace. The full list of errors is available with the global RPC `GET errors`

post.description: Request the operations of our peers or a specific peer if specified via a query parameter.

schema.description: An error trace. The full list of errors is available with the global RPC `GET errors`

post.description: Clear the set of banned operations.

schema.description: An error trace. The full list of errors is available with the global RPC `GET errors`

post.description: Remove an operation from the set of banned operations (nothing happens if it was not banned).

schema.description: An error trace. The full list of errors is available with the global RPC `GET errors`

Operation_list_list_hash.title: A list of list of operations (Base58Check-encoded)

Signature.Public_key.title: A Ed25519, Secp256k1, or P256 public key (Base58Check-encoded)

Signature.Public_key_hash.title: A Ed25519, Secp256k1, P256, or BLS public key hash (Base58Check-encoded)

Signature.V1.title: A Ed25519, Secp256k1, P256 or BLS signature (Base58Check-encoded)

alpha.block_header.alpha.full_header.title: Shell header
alpha.block_header.alpha.full_header.description: Block header's shell-related content. It contains information such as the block level, its predecessor and timestamp.

alpha.contract_id.title: A contract handle
alpha.contract_id.description: A contract notation as given to an RPC or inside scripts. Can be a base58 implicit contract hash or a base58 originated contract hash.

alpha.contract_id.originated.title: A contract handle -- originated account
alpha.contract_id.originated.description: A contract notation as given to an RPC or inside scripts. Can be a base58 originated contract hash.

alpha.entrypoint.title: entrypoint
alpha.entrypoint.description: Named entrypoint to a Michelson smart contract

bignum.title: Big number
bignum.description: Decimal representation of a big number

error.description: An error trace. The full list of errors is available with the global RPC `GET errors`

error_opt.description: An optional error-trace (None indicates no error). The full list of errors is available with the global RPC `GET errors`

fitness.title: Block fitness
fitness.description: The fitness, or score, of a block, that allow the Tezos to decide which chain is the best. A fitness value is a list of byte sequences. They are compared as follows: shortest lists are smaller; lists of the same length are compared according to the lexicographical order.

oneOf.title: Prim__generic
oneOf.description: Generic primitive (any number of args with or without annotations)

positive_bignum.title: Positive big number
positive_bignum.description: Decimal representation of a positive big number

smart_rollup_commitment_hash.title: The hash of a commitment of a smart rollup (Base58Check-encoded)

smart_rollup_state_hash.title: The hash of the VM state of a smart rollup (Base58Check-encoded)

timestamp.protocol.description: A timestamp as seen by the protocol: second-level precision, epoch based.

unistring.title: Universal string representation
unistring.description: Either a plain UTF8 string, or a sequence of bytes for strings that contain invalid byte sequences.
